title: The Infinite Hotel Paradox - Jeff Dekofsky

multiple-choice.question: In the Infinite Hotel thought experiment, a man walks into the hotel and asks for a room when the hotel is already full with an infinite number of guests. How does the night manager accommodate this new guest?

options.label: A
options.text: He turns the guest away, as there are no available rooms.

options.label: B
options.text: He asks the guest in room number 1 to move to room 2, the guest in room 2 to move to room 3, and so on.

options.label: C
options.text: He builds a new wing with additional rooms.

options.label: D
options.text: He gives the guest a key to a room that is already occupied.

multiple-choice.question: What is the concept of "countably infinite" in the context of the Infinite Hotel?

options.label: A
options.text: It refers to a finite number of guests that can be counted.

options.label: B
options.text: It refers to an infinite number of guests that can be put into a one-to-one correspondence with the natural numbers.

options.label: C
options.text: It refers to an infinite number of guests that cannot be counted.

options.label: D
options.text: It refers to a finite number of rooms in the hotel.

multiple-choice.question: How does the night manager accommodate an infinite bus with a countably infinite number of passengers?

options.label: A
options.text: He asks each current guest to move from room number "n" to room number "2n", filling up only the infinite even-numbered rooms.

options.label: B
options.text: He asks each current guest to move from room number "n" to room number "n+1", filling up only the infinite odd-numbered rooms.

options.label: C
options.text: He builds a new wing with additional rooms.

options.label: D
options.text: He gives each passenger a key to a room that is already occupied.

options.text: It refers to the highest level of infinity.

options.label: B
options.text: It refers to the lowest level of infinity, mainly the countable infinity of the natural numbers.

options.label: C
options.text: It refers to a finite number of guests.

options.label: D
options.text: It refers to an infinite number of rooms in the hotel.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Because there are too many guests in the hotel.

options.label: C
options.text: Because we have no way to systematically include every number.

options.label: D
options.text: Because the night manager is not good at math.

options.label: C

options.label: D
